text: Tbh, it's a good ad, on point with the message they were trying to pass but I feel like they totally deviated from everything concerning their brand. At a point it felt more like a motivational video not an ad. But looking at it from another angle it could be a strategy where they try to appeal to people's (men) psychology by talking about common societal issues and how they can be solved, ultimately making people have a soft spot for the brand 😊😊😊

Lovely ad, stands for an obvious societal issue which recently moved mainstream, but I look at the ad and I connect to the story being told but not the brand, maybe the brand should hv being subtly included more, maybe I'll like to see a blend of societal issues addressed while a brand still maintains it's key messaging.

I like the ad. Its creative and addresses something happening in the society. Tbvh, why do people criticize 'brands' when they speak up against something in society? Like the brands aren't run by human beings!! If it were a celebrity speaking up, it'll be applause everywhere. I honestly feel like more brands should embrace this and make sure that they use their platform to affect change not just to sell their market.!
